author: chris2_2_2
content: There are decentralized alternatives being worked on.

author: chris2_2_2
content: Itâ€™s not set that a centralized organization(s) will become the builders.

author: tokey1475
content: Its not set but it seems very likely that one or two entities will dominate the space.  Each additional builder that a searcher submits a mev transaction to requires additional work and trust.  So if there is a large incumbent builder (such as flashbots), who already has access to the lion share of potential MEV transactions, it will be very hard for upstarts to compete with them

author: arnetheduck
content:
weird, but I'm getting an error when running `make install_test` on the consensus spec repo, fresh checkout, `dev` branch, anyone else seen this:
```
$ make install_test
python3 -m venv venv; . venv/bin/activate; python3 -m pip install -e .[lint]; python3 -m pip install -e .[test]
Obtaining file:///home/arnetheduck/status/eth2.0-specs
....
ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement milagro_bls_binding==1.6.3 (from eth2spec[lint]) (from versions: 0.1.4, 0.4.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.1)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for milagro_bls_binding==1.6.3
```

author: arnetheduck
content: it looks like the CI caches the venv, did some bls bindings disappear perhaps?

author: protolambda
content: <@!449019668296892420> I get the same error, I think it may be because of the python 3.10 update, and the milagro bls (native) library maybe not supporting that yet. <@!343424945914904577> can you take a look? Also, it would be nice if you open a GH issue for this <@!449019668296892420>

author: protolambda
content: <@!449019668296892420> <@!343424945914904577> I confirmed it's a python version issue. Installed 3.8 alongside current 3.10 install (via arch AUR) and it works fine in a 3.8 venv
